Publications

  1. A. Mani, D. Park. "Macroscopic forcing method: a tool for turbulence modeling and analysis of closures." Physical Review Fluids, 6.054607, (2021).
  2. D. Park, A. Mani. "Eddy viscosity in turbulent channel flow at Reτ=180." in preparation.
  3. D. Park, A. Mani. "Anisotropic eddy viscosity in separated boundary-layer flows." in preparation.


Presentations

  1. D. Park, J. Liu, A. Mani. "Non-Boussinesq effects of eddy viscosity in a separated turbulent boundary layer." 34th Symposium on Naval Hydrodynamics, Washington, DC, June 26-July1, 2022.
  2. D. Park, A. Mani. "Direct measurement of the eddy viscosity tensor in a canonical separated flow: What is the upper bound of accuracy for local Reynolds stress models?." AIAA SciTech Forum, San Diego, CA, January 3-7, 2022.
  3. D. Park, A. Mani. "Direct calculation of eddy viscosity of turbulent channel flow at Reτ=180." The 25th International Congress of Theoretical and Applied Mechanics, Milano, Italy & Online, August 22-27, 2021.
  4. D. Park, A. Mani. "Anisotropic eddy viscosity in a separated turbulent boundary layer." The 73rd Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society’s Division of Fluid Dynamics, Chicago, IL & Online, November 22-24, 2020.
  5. D. Lansigan, D. Park, A. Mani. "An accelerated macroscopic forcing method (MFM) for determining eddy viscosity operators." The 73rd Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society’s Division of Fluid Dynamics, Chicago, IL & Online, November 22-24, 2020.
  6. D. Park, A. Mani. "Direct calculation of eddy viscosity of turbulent channel flow." The 72nd Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society’s Division of Fluid Dynamics, Seattle, WA, November 23-26, 2019.
  7. D. Park. "Macroscopic forcing method: a tool for turbulence modeling and analysis of closures." Seminar at Seoul National University, Seoul, Korea, July 1, 2019.
  8. D. Park, A. Mani. "Macroscopic forcing method and its application in assesement of RANS models." The 71st Annual Meeting of the American Physical Society’s Division of Fluid Dynamics, Atlanta, GA, November 18-20, 2018.
  9. D. Park, A. Mani. "A study on improvement of sprinkler head design using computational fluid dynamics.." Annual Spring Meeting of the Korean Society for Computational Fluids Engineering, Jeju, Korea, May 2015.
